reply_text:
Thank you for highlighting this issue.
It is understandable that this Covid-19 Crisis has put extreme stress on all, with Healthcare sector being no exception. Great maturity is needed to have  clarity in mind that Doctor has given his complete attention, time and resources in a Teleconsultation before giving appropriate advice. Fee has been charged for the service already given. When the same person chooses physical consultation, Doctor is again giving his complete time & attention for physical examination, apply his resources and answer all the doubts by patient and relative. Hence it is not right to expect teleconsultation fee already paid to cover the new services sought in the form of physical consultation. It is felt that we were not wrong in charging Fee for Physical Consultation. However it is a different matter that the type of mature understanding we expect is not available in our Society, as Teleconsultation is an evolving concept in our Country.
It is not less than any defamation or harassment directed to us unnecessarily, to receive a false allegation while simultaneously suffering revenue loss as the Physical Consultation stands not paid by the Patient till today.
Dr.madan
